scenario_1_happy_path.message: Hi, I am the patient
Welcome! Thank you for confirming. I'll now show you a form to fill in your details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Thank you, Sarah Jones! I've collected all the information we need. We've noted your preference to be contacted via email. You'll now be connected with our clinical team for your pre-consultation assessment.
I have mild abdominal discomfort on the right side, level 3 out of 10

Hi Sarah, welcome to the clinical assessment! I'll be helping you today to gather some information before your consultation. I'm going to ask you a few questions now, which will help us get a better understanding of what's going on and ensure you get the best possible care.
I take amlodipine 5mg daily. No known allergies. I don't smoke or drink.
Thanks for sharing that. To help me understand what might be going on, can you tell me approximately where on your right side you're feeling the discomfort?
The discomfort started about 2 weeks ago. It comes and goes.

Okay, I've got that noted about the amlodipine and your healthy habits.

How long have you been taking it, and has the abdominal discomfort started around the same time?
no documents
Do you have any recent recent blood test results to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
nothing else to add
Your clinical assessment is now complete. Based on the information gathered, your case has been assessed as LOW priority. Our booking team will now arrange your consultation appointment.

Based on your LOW risk assessment, we need to book your consultation within 30 days. Here are the available appointments:

  1. 2026-02-27 at 09:00 with Dr. Available
  2. 2026-02-27 at 10:00 with Dr. Available
  3. 2026-02-27 at 11:00 with Dr. Available

Please reply with the number of your preferred slot (1, 2, or 3).
I didn't quite catch your selection. Please reply with 1, 2, or 3 to choose one of the offered appointment slots, or let me know if none of these times work for you.
feeling fine, no concerns
That's great to hear you're feeling fine and have no concerns, Sarah! Just wanted to confirm I received your message. See you at your appointment on February 27th.

Hi Sarah, it's your friend Marie at the clinic! I'm just checking in to see how you're feeling after the last visit. I hope you're doing well! Has your abdominal discomfort changed in any way since we last spoke? For example, is it more intense, spreading to other areas, or associated with new symptoms like nausea, vomiting, fever, or changes in bowel habits?
feeling fine, everything is good
Hi Sarah, great to hear that you're feeling fine and everything is good! Just wanted to confirm I received your message. Looking forward to seeing you on February 27th for your appointment.

Hi Sarah, it's your friend Amy, the nurse from the clinic! It's been about a month since your initial assessment, and I wanted to check in and see how you're feeling in general. Since starting amlodipine, have you noticed any side effects, such as swelling in your ankles or feet, dizziness, or headaches?
still feeling fine, no issues
That's great to hear you're still feeling fine, Sarah! Everything looks good on our end too. Just keep an eye out and we'll see you at your appointment on February 27th.
Hi Sarah, it's Nurse [Your Name] from the clinic! It's been about 60 days since we last spoke, and I wanted to see how you're feeling overall. Everything going okay for you?
doing great, no problems at all
That's wonderful to hear, Sarah! It sounds like you're doing great and experiencing no problems, which is excellent news. We'll see you on February 27th for your appointment!

scenario_2_complex_clinical.message: Hello, I'm filling in for my father. I'm his daughter.
Thank you for helping with the registration. I'll now show you a form to fill in the patient's details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Thank you, Harold Wilson! I've collected all the information we need. We've noted your preference to be contacted via phone. You'll now be connected with our clinical team for your pre-consultation assessment.
He has liver cirrhosis with ascites and portal hypertension. Pain level 7 out of 10. Severe abdominal swelling.
Could you tell me what's been bothering you today?
He takes propranolol 40mg, spironolactone 100mg, lactulose 15ml three times daily, rifaximin 550mg twice daily, metformin 500mg, and warfarin 5mg.

Okay, I've got all of that noted down.

Since you mentioned you're feeling bothered, could you tell me when this started and if it's been getting better, worse, or staying the same?
He's allergic to penicillin which causes anaphylaxis, and allergic to codeine which causes nausea.

Alright, I've made a note of his penicillin and codeine allergies.

Okay, you mentioned feeling bothered; can you tell me, are you experiencing any abdominal pain or discomfort related to your ascites?
The pain has been worse for 2 weeks. His ankles are very swollen. He stopped drinking 3 years ago.

Okay, two weeks of increased pain and ankle swelling is good to know, as is the information about his sobriety.

On a scale of 0 to 10, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst pain imaginable, what number would you give your abdominal pain or discomfort?
no documents

Okay, I understand that you don't have any documents with you.

Since you're on a few medications, are you taking them as prescribed, and have you noticed any new or worsening side effects?
nothing else to add
Do you have any recent liver function tests to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
nothing else to add
Your clinical assessment is now complete. Based on the information gathered, your case has been assessed as HIGH priority. Our booking team will now arrange your consultation appointment.

Based on your HIGH risk assessment, we need to book your consultation within 2 days. Here are the available appointments:

  1. 2026-02-27 at 10:00 with Dr. Available
  2. 2026-02-27 at 11:00 with Dr. Available
  3. 2026-02-27 at 11:30 with Dr. Available

Please reply with the number of your preferred slot (1, 2, or 3).

Your appointment has been confirmed!

Date: 2026-02-27
Time: 10:00
Provider: Dr. Available
Appointment ID: APT-PT-1772074540-S02-2026-02-27

Pre-appointment instructions:
  - Please bring a valid photo ID and your NHS card
  - Arrive 15 minutes before your appointment time
  - Continue taking Metformin as prescribed
  - Continue taking Warfarin — bring your latest INR results
  - Avoid alcohol completely for at least 48 hours before your appointment
  - If you are on a low-sodium diet, please continue following it
  - Fasting is required for 8-12 hours before your appointment (water is fine)
  - A blood test may be required — please wear comfortable clothing with easy access to your arm
  - Please remind the clinician of your allergies: Penicillin - anaphylaxis, Codeine - nausea
  - If you experience any worsening symptoms before your appointment, please contact NHS 111 or attend A&E
  - Bring any recent lab results, imaging reports, or medication lists that you haven't already shared with us

We'll keep in touch before your appointment to check on you.

Hi Harold, it's your friendy neighborhood nurse checking in! How have you been feeling this past week? I'm especially interested to know if you've noticed any changes in the amount or appearance of fluid in your abdomen (ascites) – is it more swollen, tight, or uncomfortable than usual?
Feeling fine, no changes to report

That's great to hear you're feeling fine, Harold, and that there haven't been any changes. Just a gentle reminder, since you're in the high-risk category, please don't hesitate to reach out to your emergency contacts if anything *does* come up before your appointment on February 27th, 2026. We're here for you too!

Hi Harold, this is [Your Name] from the clinic. Just wanted to see how you're feeling two weeks after your last assessment. How's everything going, and have you noticed any signs of bleeding, such as nosebleeds, bleeding gums, unusual bruising, blood in your stool, or vomiting blood?
All good, feeling well, taking medications on schedule

Hi Harold, it's Nurse Jenny from the clinic. How are you feeling today? Since it's been about a month since your last assessment, I wanted to check in and see if you've noticed any side effects from your medications, like dizziness from the propranolol, any muscle cramps from the spironolactone, or maybe some diarrhea with the lactulose or rifaximin, or any other changes. Looking forward to seeing you again on February 27th!
Feeling okay, a bit more tired but otherwise the same

Hi Harold, thanks for the update. It's good to hear you're feeling okay, even if you're a bit more tired. Remember, if anything changes or you feel significantly worse, don't hesitate to reach out or contact emergency services. We'll see you on February 27th.
We've reviewed your latest results and noticed some changes that need attention. Our clinical team has been notified and will reassess your case. We may need to adjust your appointment timing.

Thank you for this update. Your case now requires urgent clinical review. Please contact NHS 111 or visit your nearest urgent care centre. Our clinical team has been notified and will prioritise your case. Your appointment on 2026-02-27 at 10:00 remains in place.
I've been feeling much worse, very fatigued, skin looks yellow, pain is 9 out of 10

I'm sorry to hear you're not feeling well, Harold Wilson. I need to ask you a few quick questions so our clinical team can properly assess the situation.

Thank you for letting us know. To best understand what's happening, when did the yellowing of your skin and increased pain start, and can you describe the location and nature of the pain?
Is there anything else you'd like to let us know?

scenario_3_cross_phase_routing.message: Hi, I am the patient
Welcome! Thank you for confirming. I'll now show you a form to fill in your details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Thank you, Michael Cross! I've collected all the information we need. We've noted your preference to be contacted via email. You'll now be connected with our clinical team for your pre-consultation assessment.
I have abdominal pain, level 5 out of 10, right side

Hi Michael, welcome to your clinical assessment! I see you don't have a referral letter, so we'll just start from the beginning. I'm going to ask you a few questions to get a better understanding of what's going on, which will help prepare you for your consultation.
I take amlodipine 5mg daily. No known allergies. No surgeries.
Thanks for letting me know. Can you describe the pain a bit more? Is it sharp, dull, crampy, or something else?
The pain started 2 weeks ago and is gradually getting worse.

Okay, so amlodipine 5mg daily, no allergies, and no surgeries.

When did your abdominal pain start, and has it been constant or intermittent?
I don't drink or smoke.
Do you have any recent recent blood test results to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
no documents
Do you have any recent referral letters to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
nothing else to add

Oh wait, I forgot to mention I'm allergic to penicillin

It causes a rash and hives
Thank you, I've added that to your clinical record.

Now, back to your appointment booking. Here are your available slots:

  1. 2026-02-27 at 11:00 with Dr. Available
  2. 2026-02-27 at 11:30 with Dr. Available
  3. 2026-02-27 at 14:00 with Dr. Available

Please reply with 1, 2, or 3 to choose your preferred time.
I'll take slot 1, and my next of kin is Carlos Santos on 07700123456

Your appointment has been confirmed!

Date: 2026-02-27
Time: 11:00
Provider: Dr. Available
Appointment ID: APT-PT-1772074540-S03-2026-02-27

Pre-appointment instructions:
  - Please bring a valid photo ID and your NHS card
  - Arrive 15 minutes before your appointment time
  - Please remind the clinician of your allergies: Penicillin, rash and hives
  - Bring any recent lab results, imaging reports, or medication lists that you haven't already shared with us

We'll keep in touch before your appointment to check on you.
By the way, I've also started taking omeprazole 20mg for my stomach
I've updated your phone number, next of kin (name and contact number) on file.
Oh, I should mention, I've changed my GP. It's now Dr. Williams
I've updated your GP name on file.
Is there anything else you'd like to let us know?
I'm not taking any new medication
Actually, I also discovered I'm allergic to ibuprofen — it gave me a rash
I've noted your allergy to Ibuprofen - rash and updated your clinical record.
Is there anything else you'd like to let us know?

Hi Michael, it's your friend Janice from the clinic checking in. How have you been feeling these last couple of weeks? Since we last spoke about your abdominal pain, can you tell me if the location, intensity (on a scale of 1 to 10), or character has changed? For example, is it sharper, duller, or radiating to other areas?
feeling fine, thanks
Great to hear you're feeling fine, Michael! Just keep an eye out for any changes, and we'll see you at your appointment on February 27th. Let us know if anything comes up before then.

Hi Michael, it's Nurse [Your Name] checking in on you. How have you been feeling these last 30 days? I wanted to check if you've experienced any new symptoms since we last spoke, such as fever, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, or blood in your stool or urine. Looking forward to seeing you at your appointment on February 27, 2026!
all good
Great to hear that everything is "all good," Michael! Just let us know if anything changes before your appointment on February 27th. We're here if you need anything at all.

Hi Michael, just wanted to see how you're doing! It's been about 60 days since your assessment, and I'm thinking of you. Have you taken your amlodipine 5mg dose today, and have you noticed any side effects like dizziness, swelling in your ankles, or headaches? Let me know!
no issues at all
Great to hear you're having "no issues at all," Michael! Just keep an eye out and let us know if anything changes before your appointment on February 27th. We're here if you need anything!

scenario_4_rescheduler_edge_cases.message: Hi, I am the patient
Welcome! Thank you for confirming. I'll now show you a form to fill in your details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Thank you, Rachel Green! I've collected all the information we need. We've noted your preference to be contacted via email. You'll now be connected with our clinical team for your pre-consultation assessment.
I have abdominal pain, level 6 out of 10
I understand you're experiencing abdominal pain at a level 6. Can you describe the pain? For example, is it sharp, dull, cramping, or something else?
Actually it's more like 8 out of 10, it's getting worse

Okay, an 8 out of 10, I understand. That sounds really intense.

I'm sorry to hear the pain is getting worse. Has anything specific triggered the increase in pain, or did it just come on suddenly?
No known allergies
Okay, good to know. Just to be absolutely sure, have you ever experienced any unusual reactions or side effects to medications, food, insect bites, or anything else?
Actually I'm allergic to penicillin, sorry I forgot
No problem at all, it's important to get that right! To clarify, does the penicillin allergy cause a rash, swelling, or both?
I take lisinopril daily for high blood pressure
Do you have any recent recent blood test results to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
no documents

Welcome! Thank you for confirming. I'll now show you a form to fill in your details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Liver pain, level 5 out of 10

Hi Emergency Patient, welcome to the clinical assessment! I'm the clinical triage nurse, and I'll be helping to prepare you for your consultation today. I'm going to ask you a few questions to get a better understanding of what's going on, so we can make sure you get the best possible care.
No meds. No allergies.

Okay, I've noted that you're not taking any medications and have no known allergies.

Just to double-check and be completely thorough, are you currently taking any medications, including over-the-counter medications, herbal remedies, or supplements?
no documents

Okay, moderate and recent pain, I understand. Let's start by figuring out what's going on.

What brings you in today?
nothing else to add

Okay, so no documents at this time.

scenario_5_full_monitoring.message: Hi, I am the patient
Welcome! Thank you for confirming. I'll now show you a form to fill in your details. [SHOW_INTAKE_FORM]

Thank you, Eve Taylor! I've collected all the information we need. We've noted your preference to be contacted via email. You'll now be connected with our clinical team for your pre-consultation assessment.
I have hepatitis C. I've been on treatment for 6 months. Some fatigue and mild abdominal discomfort, pain level 4 out of 10.
Could you tell me the name of the medication you're taking for hepatitis C and what dose you're on?
I take ribavirin 200mg twice daily and sofosbuvir 400mg daily. No known allergies.

Okay, I've made a note of the ribavirin and sofosbuvir dosages and that you have no known allergies.

Are you taking your medications as prescribed, or have you missed any doses?
I had a liver biopsy last year. My ALT was slightly elevated at my last blood test.
Do you have any recent hepatitis panel results to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
I don't drink alcohol. I quit 2 years ago.
Do you have any recent viral load tests to share? You can upload them now, or say 'no' if you don't have them.
no documents

Pre-appointment instructions:
  - Please bring a valid photo ID and your NHS card

  - Avoid alcohol completely for at least 48 hours before your appointment
  - If you are on a low-sodium diet, please continue following it
  - If you experience any worsening symptoms before your appointment, please contact NHS 111 or attend A&E
  - Bring any recent lab results, imaging reports, or medication lists that you haven't already shared with us

We'll keep in touch before your appointment to check on you.

Hi Eve, it's your friendliest neighborhood clinic nurse checking in! How have you been feeling these last two weeks? Since we last spoke, has your abdominal pain changed – is it more sharp or dull, constant or does it come and go? Could you also give me a pain rating from 0 to 10?
feeling fine, managing well with the treatment

Hi Eve, that's wonderful to hear you're feeling fine and managing well with the treatment! Please continue to monitor your symptoms and I look forward to seeing you at your appointment on February 27th, 2026.
Thank you for uploading your latest results. We've compared them to your baseline values and everything looks stable. Your appointment is still on track.

Hi Eve, it's your friend Marie at the clinic! I'm checking in on you as you approach the one-month mark since your assessment. Given your elevated ALT levels and treatment with ribavirin and sofosbuvir, have you noticed any new or worsening side effects such as nausea, muscle aches, rash, difficulty breathing, or changes in your stool or urine color?
still doing well, no changes

That's great to hear you're still doing well, Eve, and that there haven't been any changes! We appreciate you keeping us updated. Just let us know if anything shifts before your appointment on February 27, 2026.
We've reviewed your latest results and noticed some changes that need attention. Our clinical team has been notified and will reassess your case. We may need to adjust your appointment timing.

Thank you for this update. Your case now requires urgent clinical review. Please contact NHS 111 or visit your nearest urgent care centre. Our clinical team has been notified and will prioritise your case. Your appointment on 2026-02-27 at 15:00 remains in place.
I've been feeling much worse lately, very fatigued and my skin looks yellow

I'm sorry to hear you're not feeling well, Eve Taylor. I need to ask you a few quick questions so our clinical team can properly assess the situation.

"I understand you're feeling much worse, with increased fatigue and yellowing skin. On a scale of 1 to 10, with 1 being mild and 10 being the worst you can imagine, how would you rate your current level of fatigue? Also, have you noticed any abdominal pain, dark urine, pale stools, nausea, vomiting, or confusion? And is the fatigue or any other symptom preventing you from doing your usual daily activities?"

Hi Eve, it's Nurse [Your name] from the clinic! Just wanted to see how you're feeling as we continue to monitor your hepatitis. Are you noticing any changes lately, and how would you describe your overall health these days?

Hi Eve, it's Nurse [Your Name] from the clinic checking in! How are you feeling as we monitor your hepatitis? It's great to hear you quit alcohol two years ago! Have you experienced any cravings for alcohol or encountered situations that might tempt you to drink?
I've noticed blood in my stool recently

This sounds like it could be a medical emergency. Please call 999 or go to your nearest A&E immediately. Do not wait — our clinical team has been alerted and will follow up, but your immediate safety is the priority.
